thread.title: Motorcyclist clings to life after crash into backhoe: cops
thread.title_full: Motorcyclist clings to life after crash into backhoe: cops - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Motorcyclist clings to life after crash into backhoe: cops
text:
Vic Nicastro/New York Daily News Highway officers are investigating an accident in the Bronx where a man lost control of his motorcycle and crashed into a backhoe. An out-of-control motorcyclist was clinging to life after he slammed his bike into a parked backhoe in the Bronx early Tuesday, officials said.
The 26-year-old was zipping down E. 171st St. near Washington Ave. about 1:20 a.m. when he sideswiped a cab and then slammed into a backhoe parked on the side of the road, officials said.
His crumpled motorcycle was found upside down — resting on one wheel — next to the backhoe.
Paramedics rushed the motorcyclist to Lincoln Hospital, where he was listed in critical condition Tuesday morning, officials said.
Vic Nicastro/New York Daily News Reports say the motorcyclist was speeding down E. 171st St. in the Bronx when he sideswiped a vehicle and then crashed into the backhoe. ttracy@nydailynews.com
Tags: Motorcycle crash , Bronx
